subject: Re: [junit] Installation Problems
msgSnippet: ... 1. Instead of using environment variables, try this... java -cp /path/to/junit.jar;/path/to/your/test/classes;/path/to/your/production/classes
messageBody:
tanjjunit wrote:

> I downloaded junit3.8.1 and I extracted the files to under directory
> C:\junit\junit3.8.1\.....
>
> and tried to set the classpath in environmental variables in windows
> as
> c:\junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
>
> and i am posivite that junit.jar files is NOT in extension directory
> of JDK installation
>
> when I tried to complie the TestRunner I keep getting class not found
> message Can any body figure this out I tried to read messages ,other
> people here in group had but none really is wroking good hope to here
> from you

1. Instead of using environment variables, try this...

java -cp
/path/to/junit.jar;/path/to/your/test/classes;/path/to/your/production/classes
junit.textui.TestRunner fully.qualified.path.of.your.TestCase

2. Why are you compiling the TestRunner? Maybe you meant something else?

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
